Package application

Class Graph

java.lang.Object
application.Graph
public class Graph extends Object
Assembles the graph scene of the graphing calculator which allows for many different useful functions. This includes the abulity to plot multiple lines each with consistent coloring, smooth zooming in and out of the desired portion of the graph, error messaging if the user inputs an illegal expression, color indicators for each equation, and the ability to delete any equation of your choosing from the graph.
Author:
Eitan Tuchin

  • Method Details

    • doOp

      private double doOp(double range, char op)
      Applies an operator to the given range to decide whether to zoom in or out.
      Parameters:
      range - The range of the gvien axis.
      op - The given operator.
      Returns:
      range The calculated change.

    • zoomInOrOut

      private void zoomInOrOut(double x, double y, char op)
      Zooms in or out of the graph depending on user interaction with the mousepad.
      Parameters:
      x - The mouse's x-axis position within the graph.
      y - The mouse's y-axis position within the graph.
      op - The given operator.

    • createGraphScene

      protected javafx.scene.Scene createGraphScene()
      Creates a new scrollable graph scene that contains a line chart with an equation box and options to add equations, return back to the menu, remove an equation, or make a new graph scene. Allows for the graph to update dynamically. (Real time graph updates.)
      Returns:
      scene A new graph scene.

    • createOptionButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button createOptionButton(String title, String color, int deltaX)
      Helper method that takes in different properties of a Button object and applies them accordingly.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the button.
      color - The color of the button.
      deltaX - The x-axis position of the button.
      Returns:
      button The newly updated button.

    • plotEquation

      private void plotEquation(javafx.scene.layout.HBox equationBox, String equation)
      Method that does the magic. Plots data points at intervals of 1/25 over the interval from LOWER_BOUND to UPPER_BOUND and identifies asymptotes by creating a new XYChart.Series object to continue plotting the equation. Catches illegal user input.
      Parameters:
      equationBox - The given equation box.
      equation - The current user inputted expression to plot.

    • addEquationBox

      private javafx.scene.layout.VBox addEquationBox()
      Adds an equation box to the bottom panel VBox. The equation box has all the same attributes of the initial equation box apart from the ability to be removed via the remove button. The equation box contains a textfield, a color identifier, and a remove button. Allows for dynamic updates of the graph.
      Returns:
      finalEquationBox The VBox that contains the equation box that allows for error messages to appear below that particular equation box if needed.

    • displayErrorMessage

      private void displayErrorMessage(String error, javafx.scene.control.TextField tf)
      Shows that user has inputted an illegal expression by adding a Label object beneath the equation box with the error.
      Parameters:
      error - The error to display.
      tf - The given textfield.

    • assignColor

      private javafx.scene.paint.Color assignColor(ArrayList<javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series<Number,Number>> seriesArr, javafx.scene.control.TextField tf)
      Assigns a random color to the equation.
      Parameters:
      seriesArr - An array of series objects that represent one plotted equation.
      tf - The textfield assigned to that equation.
      Returns:
      seriesColor The random color that has been chosen and applied to the line.

    • getRandomLineColor

      private javafx.scene.paint.Color getRandomLineColor(Random rand)
      Gets a random color from a list of colors and does so until all colors from the list have been chosen at which point all colors can be picked at random once again.
      Parameters:
      rand - A new Random object.
      Returns:
      randColor The random color picked.
